TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ProfileProviderCollection extends System.Configuration.SettingsProviderCollection
Public NotInheritable Class ProfileProviderCollection Inherits SettingsProviderCollection

Docs.summary: A collection of objects that inherit the abstract class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The profile providers for an application are exposed as a read-only <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProviderCollection> through the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Providers%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager> class. You can access a specific profile provider in the collection by name and cast it as the specific provider type, such as <xref:System.Web.Profile.SqlProfileProvider>. This enables you to manage user profile properties from multiple data stores in a single application. It also allows you to access members of a specific profile provider that are not members of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider> abstract class.
## Examples The following code example lists the providers enabled for an application and their respective types.
[!code-aspx-csharp[System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager/CS/Providerscs.aspx#9)] [!code-aspx-vb[System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager/VB/Providersvb.aspx#9)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Creates a new, empty profile provider collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is not intended to be used from your code. The profile providers for an application are exposed as a read-only <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProviderCollection> through the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Providers%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Add(class System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderBase provider) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Add (provider As ProviderBase)

Docs.param: The profile provider to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds a profile provider to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not intended to be used from your code.
Profile provider instances are added to the `ProfileProviderCollection` for an application using the [providers Element for profile (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/9e998377-b07f-44c1-ad9b-20a60e83c18f) section of the configuration element. You can access the profile provider collection using the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Providers%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager> class.

Docs.exception: is not of a type that inherits the abstract class.

Docs.param: The name of the profile provider.
Docs.summary: Returns the profile provider referenced by the specified provider name.
Docs.value: An object that inherits the abstract class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The profile providers for an application are exposed as a read-only <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProviderCollection> through the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager.Providers%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileManager> class. You can access a specific profile provider in the collection by name and cast it as the specific provider type, such as <xref:System.Web.Profile.SqlProfileProvider>. This enables you to manage user profile properties from multiple data stores in a single application. It also allows you to access members of a specific profile provider that are not members of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileProvider> abstract class.
